title: Matrix Addition
description:
Write a function FC that implements the addition of two matrices.

The function accepts two two-dimensional arrays of floating-point numbers, matrix1 and matrix2, of variable lengths as input parameters. The function should check whether the two input matrices and the output matrix for the result have the same number of rows and columns. If they do not, it should return an error status and a specific error code.

Status codes:
16#0000: Execution of FC without error
16#8200: The lower bound of the first matrix array rows is different from the lower bound of the second matrix rows
16#8201: The lower bound of the first matrix array rows is different from the lower bound of the result matrix rows
16#8202: The lower bound of the first matrix array columns is different from the lower bound of the second matrix columns
16#8203: The lower bound of the first matrix array columns is different from the lower bound of the result matrix columns
16#8204: The upper bound of the first matrix array rows is different from the upper bound of the second matrix rows
16#8205: The upper bound of the first matrix array rows is different from the upper bound of the result matrix rows
16#8206: The upper bound of the first matrix array columns is different from the upper bound of the second matrix columns
16#8207: The upper bound of the first matrix array columns is different from the upper bound of the result matrix columns
name: MatrixAddition

output.name: error
output.description: FALSE: No error occurred; TRUE: An error occurred during the execution of FC

in/out.name: matrixResult
in/out.description: The matrix where the calculation result is stored
